title: Everyday English Course 100
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What does the woman suggest the man do?
What is the cause of their complaint?
Where should Miss Jenkins work in?
What do they want to do?
Why did the man go to the hospital?
When will the next plane for L. A. take off?
What's the woman's address?
What are the man and woman doing?

questionTemplates.text:
W: You look so angry. What happened?
M: Nothing, I'd rather not talk about it. Just don't ask.
W: Come on. I think you need to let off some anger. Not have your feelings held back like that. It'll eat your life.
{a}

variables.a: What does the woman suggest the man should do?

answerOptions: The skin cancer is easy to cure.

The skin cancer need not be worried about.
instances.correctAnswer: The skin cancer is a common cancer.

questionTemplates.text:
W: Mike, there's not much left in the refrigerator.
M: Well, I might be able to pick up a few things after work, but I have to be back rather late today.
W: In that case, we'll make do with a meal out at McDonald's.
{a}

answerOptions: The man will bring some food back for dinner.

instances.correctAnswer: They will eat out for dinner.
